name: Somebody's Watching Me
tagline: a python module using omegalib and osgearth to view crime data of Chicago
body:
### Welcome!
Welcome to the homepage of my first project of Fall 2013 Semester, Somebody's Watching Me, project 1 of Professor [Andy Johnson](http://www.evl.uic.edu/aej/)'s [Visualization](http://www.evl.uic.edu/aej/526/index.html) course.

### Introduction
This project is written for CAVE2. It 
Fig.1 Overview of Chicago



### Download and Install
1. have omegalib and osgearth installed. instruction for Mac [here](https://github.com/uic-evl/omegalib/wiki/How-to-run-osgearth-in-omegalib-on-Mac)
2. download the source code from [Github](https://github.com/joysword/cs526.project1/)
3. download data files at http://1234567, and put them **directly** in the project directory
4. to run the project, do as following:
```
> cd [omegalib_build]/bin/
> ./orun -s [where_you_put_the_project]/shiyin-p1.py
```

### About the Data
Data used in this project is coming from different sources, including but not limiting to
* [City of Chicago Data Portal](https://data.cityofchicago.org/)
* [Open Street Map](http://www.openstreetmap.org/)
* [Yahoo! Map](http://maps.yahoo.com/)
* [OSGEARTH](http://osgearth.org/)

[More info](data.html) about the Data

### Interesting Findings
at http://12345678
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
